event.title: 1890, as smaller ranches and farmlands were being purchased

data.event: Sometime in 1889 or 1890, as smaller ranches and farmlands were being purchased, Ernest Theodore O'Neil, his brother-in-law John Simon McConnell, and John W. Swearingen, together had purchased the land upon which the town currently sits, for $5.00 per acre.
The 1890 census showed 357 inhabitants across the county, with 89 ranches and farms and 335 acres (1.36 km2) of land in cultivation.
In August 1890, a petition was circulated to organize the county, choose a county seat, and elect county officers.
